title: Issues with Blackboard and Zoom with Enhanced Protection
content:
I am an administrator at a university and we use Blackboard and Zoom as a couple of the tools at our university. We install Firefox on all of our PCs across campus. After a recent update, when our instructors try to launch Zoom using the integration setup in Blackboard, the meeting fails to launch. We have found that disabling Enhanced Protection fixes this issue. Is there a way to add this exception to an install file that can be sent across many PCs on our campus? We have hundreds of PCs and going from one to another to install this exception would not be practical.

Do you have any suggestions? Justin
creator: Justin.Bronstein

title: Nenhum site abre no Firefox
content:
Não consigo abrir nenhum site no Firefox. No entanto, consigo abrir em outros navegadores (esta mensagem está sendo editada no Chrome). Já reinstalei e desinstalei o navegador várias vezes. Sem sucesso. Em qualquer site que tento acesso (youtube, google, suporte da mozilla), recebo a seguinte mensagem:

"Falha na conexão segura

Ocorreu um erro durante uma conexão com www.mozilla.org. PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR 

   A página que você está tentando ver não pode ser exibida porque a autenticidade dos dados recebidos não pôde ser comprovada.    Entre em contato com os responsáveis pelo site para informar este problema."

Solicito ajuda. Grato desde já, Leonardo Marques
creator: leonardoamarques

creator: JimPaterson

title: Bookmarks Bar is Totally Blank Following Device Restart, and Restoring Defalts Did Nothing
content:
As stated in the topic title, I recently had to restart my POC to finish a BitDefender Installation, however, when signing back in, and launching Firefox, I found out my Bookmarks Toolbar was completely devoid of literally anything.

As is normally the case when something goes wrong, I did a search and found a topic from 2018 saying to restore the defaults in the Customize tab, which I did without issue. As it would turn out, though, this still didn't fix anything, and the bar came back every bit as blank as it was prior to this.

All the bookmarks are still registered, and in the same places I've put them, and I even tried bookmarking this page while setting it to go directly to the toolbar, rather than any of the subfolders I'd set, and as proven in the screenshots, nothing showed up.

I suspect that something may have corrupted, but I updated the browser days prior to this, so if anything was cut off before it could finish, it seemed likelier it would have happened then rather than now. As well, no red flags were brought back when doing a virus scan, so I'm at a total loss for what could have even happened, much less how to fix it.
creator: Teominious

title: Playing DSAH low latency stream on Player is always choppy only happen on Firefox browser
content:
1、Test package(Player) https://watchparty.visualon.com/hkjc/SamplePlayer/sampleplayer/

2、Test OS version and devices: Windows 10 PC Firefox version : Firefox 104.0 (20220818191623)

3、Bug description: Playing DSAH low latency stream on Player is always choppy on Firefox browser Same player and stream playback normally in Chrome browser.

4、Reproducing rate 100%

5、Steps to reproduce Steps: 1) Open Firefox 2) Open website :https://watchparty.visualon.com/hkjc/SamplePlayer/sampleplayer/ 3) Select "Dash Stream Tear" -> "DASH Channel 1" 4) Press "Load" to playback channel 5) Can see video always choppy

6、Question: 1) Does Firefox not support DASH low latency stream playback？ 2)There are similar cases？ Could tell the root cause？ 3)Any suggestion to fix this issue？

Let me know if you want more information.
creator: allenhuang2016

title: Slow Start Up on Ubuntu 22.04 wXFCE
content:
Hello,

I've spent several hours today trying to fix FireFox slow start up on my system. After start up (about 2 full minutes), everything works normally. The hardware is an ASUS A88xm-A MB, A10-6800K processor, 16G DDR3, runs OS and programs off an SSD. I worked through all the slow startup suggestions, ran memtest (0 Errors, 1 Pass), disabled all add ons, (even the OpenH264 video codec (I use the onboard HDMI, no graphics card)), turned off hardware acceleration, etc. When starting in troubleshoot mode, less than 30 seconds, (acceptable), but I really don't know where to begin with the "More Troubleshooting Information" when I look at the table generated by it. There have been no other problems to date with the system, and the long start-up time began with 20.04 Ubuntu (about a minute), then got worse when I upgraded to 22.04 to try to solve THAT problem. Currently running FF 104.0, and the update page says wait for a distro update if that is how it was installed. I believe 104.0 is the latest Linux 64b version though. All updates to the system are done as soon as I'm notified of them. there have been none since the upgrade a few days ago.

Any suggestions? Gotta get some sleep now... TIA, Dave
creator: dkosewick

title: Firefox password sync causes crash? [Ubuntu Focal]
content:
Brand new installation of Ubuntu Focal (on an ARM Chromebook, using Crouton). Installed Firefox (104), runs fine but as soon as I sign into my Firefox account it immediately crashes. Continues to crash if I start in safe-mode, so I don't think the problem is an extension. After some online research and some trial and error I seem to have determined that I can sign into my Firefox account as long as password sync is disabled. But as soon as I enable password sync, Firefox immediately crashes.

Error message in terminal is always about GPU, which maybe isn't properly set up or maybe Firefox has a problem with it, but if I use the software renderer it doesn't cause a problem (MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=0 firefox). Hard to imagine that this has anything to do with crashing when syncing passwords?

Crash Annotation GraphicsCriticalError: |[0][GFX1-]: No GPUs detected via PCI (t=2.77546) [GFX1-]: No GPUs detected via PCI Crash Annotation GraphicsCriticalError: |[0][GFX1-]: No GPUs detected via PCI (t=2.77546) |[1][GFX1-]: glxtest: process failed (received signal 11) (t=2.77573) [GFX1-]: glxtest: process failed (received signal 11) Missing chrome or resource URL: resource://gre/modules/UpdateListener.sys.mjs Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error. Crash Annotation GraphicsCriticalError: |[C0][GFX1-]: Receive IPC close with reason=AbnormalShutdown (t=3.29811) Exiting due to channel error. Segmentation fault (core dumped)
creator: mc510

title: OpenH264 fails to install with HTTPS-Only mode enabled
content:
"OpenH264 Video Codec provided by Cisco Systems, Inc." plugin will sit in the "will be installed shortly" status forever if you have HTTPS-Only mode enabled. I have been pulling my hair out for the last few days trying to figure out why I couldn't play YouTube or many other sites videos.

Turns out the site that the library is downloaded from has a bad certificate installed: https://ciscobinary.openh264.org/libopenh264-2.3.0-linux64.6.so.bz2

``` Websites prove their identity via certificates. Firefox does not trust this site because it uses a certificate that is not valid for ciscobinary.openh264.org. The certificate is only valid for the following names: a248.e.akamai.net, *.akamaihd-staging.net, *.akamaihd.net, *.akamaized-staging.net, *.akamaized.net

Error code: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN ```

OS: Fedora 36 Firefox Version: 104.0 (64-bit)
creator: CorruptComputer
